intro: Streptanthera tricolor, commonly known as the three-color orchid, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its strikingly colorful flowers that display three distinct hues. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are elliptical and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators with their vibrant colors and sweet fragrance.
